title: The ratio of the ages of a and b is 9:4 three years ago the ratio of their ages was 3:1, what is their present age? - Quora

response.answer_text: We will not follow any long method, the approach which i am putting in front of you guys let you do it orally. Given ratios: 9:4 & 3:1 Multiply 9:4 with difference of 3 and 1 ie 2 & Multiply 3:1 with difference of 9 and 4 ie 5.   Now, difference of 18 and 15 or 8 and 5 is 3. Take 3R= no of years ago 3R=3=》R=1 Present ages : 18R and 8R ie 18×1 and 8×1 ie 18 and 8

Ratio of the ages of A and B = 9:4 Let the age of A is 9x Then age of B is 4x Age of A three years back = 9x - 3 Age of B three years back = 4x - 3 Therefore (9x - 3):(4x -3) :: 3:1 So, (9x -3) = 3 (4x -3) 9x -3 = 12x -9 3x = 6 or. x =2 So present age of A = 18 and B = 8

Let their present ages be 9x and 4x Three years ago their ages must be 9x-3 and 4x-3 Now it is given 9x-3/4x-3=3/1 9x-3=12x-9 3x=6 x=2 Since their present ages are 9x and 4x Hence their ages are 18 and 8 years respectively. Please upvote if it helps Thank you…

THE RATIO OF AGES OF A AND B=9:4 LET THIS BE 9X AND 4X THREE YEARS AGO 9X-3 AND 4X-3 RATIO=3:1 9X-3/4X-3=3/1 1(9X-3)=3(4X-3) 9X-3=12X-9 -3+9=12X-9X 6=3X 6/3=X 2=X PRESENT RATIO=9X AND 4X X=2 9*2=18 4*2=8 ANSWER IS 18 YEARS AND 8 YEARS
The present ages of a and b be are 9x and 4x. Three years ago their ratio of their ages was (9x-3):(4x-3)::3:1. Or 3(4x-3) = 1(9x-3) 12x-9 = 9x-3 3x=6, x = 2 A is 18 years and b is 8 years now,
Let n be the common factor between their ages. Then: 3n+3/n+3=9/4 9n+27=12n+12 3n=15 n=5 3 years ago, a and b were 15 and 5. Now, they are 18 and 8 ☺☺☺☺
